Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is seen as a form of censorship that undermines free speech.
Fact-checking and interventions are ineffective and lose credibility over time.
Historical examples like the Iraq War and Covid-19 response show that official narratives can be flawed.
Science is a process that evolves, and the legislation assumes scientific facts are static.
The legislation could violate the implied freedom of political communication in Australia.
Notable Quotes: The solution to bad free speech is always more free speech.
Science is not a set of established facts. Science is a process for testing hypotheses.
The response of the Australian polity...is to go after the already suppressed speech rights of the very people who correctly tried to warn everyone else.
